website_summaries.verdict: People rained praise on the Topo Athletic Terraventure 2. This trail companion worked well for them. They welcomed its spacious toe box, its grip-ready outsole unit, the confident performance on rocky and soft surfaces, and the accommodating sizing schemes. It’s apparently a step up from its predecessor. The noticeable aspect that didn’t sit well with some consumers was its weight as it apparently dragged the foot. Still, the sequestered concern wasn’t a deal-breaker as shoe enthusiasts still flocked to this product for their off-road adventures.
pros: The forefoot section of the Topo Athletic Terraventure 2 was lauded by consumers for being wide enough to accommodate natural toe-splay
Some testers commented that the outsole unit was able to provide reliable traction over rocky and muddy surfaces
People felt that the sizing scheme of this running shoe followed their usual preferences
The firm midsole unit was considered by several purchasers to be an excellent platform for rough topography
Mud was able to slough off quickly because of the evenly-spaced gripping lugs, a handful of people reported
According to a couple of runners, the heel section of the upper held the foot sufficiently, preventing any accidental shoe removals
cons: A few people noted that they were able to notice the weight of this shoe, stating that it was heavier than their usual fare

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Solid Trainer, Also Good for Hiking
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I confess, I am a running shoe nut. I have a massive rotation of shoes, and have tried many popular models. However, this is my first Topo. I am super impressed. I used these to hike in Moab as well as light trail running. They’re not racing shoes, but they’re comfortable and confidence-inspiring. The overall fit and feel is superb. Midsole has a slightly soft feel that really matches the overall character. Not springy, not spongy. They feel like they fulfill on all the Altra promises, better than Altra does. I am definitely going to try more Topos in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MSR

customer_reviews.title: Great but not as grippy as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I've taken these shoes on a large number of hikes and trail runs in California, Washington State, Norway, Spain and Portugal. They are lightweight and super comfortable. The main problem is that the soles don't feel as grippy as other hiking shoes that I've had in the past. I was slipping and sliding around on rocks in the Cascades last weekend and just felt less confident on technical terrain. Overall, I do like these shoes - if the terrain isn't too difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, durable, good traction. Has a nice fit and roomier toe box than average shoe. I was looking for an option to Altra. This site is good but not as good as Altra and just as expensive. However it seems a little more durable as far as outsole and appearance. But the missile seems to degrade quicker. Saw the same thing with topo road shoe as well. Very good but there are potentially better choices depending on your goal/situation.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hornbeck

customer_reviews.title: Love them, but run small
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Fantastic right out of the box. They run small, I bought a full size larger. I road run with Altra’s size 11 and needed size 12 in topo’s. Light, flexible and have great traction. I love the rock place, they still have good ground feedback, without allowing painful rock strikes
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: Wide Toe Box comfort...ahhhh
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of pairs of Altra shoes and tried these as an alternative shoe that has the wide toe box I need. I've had hit or miss luck with Altra quality, these Topos were great. In addition to great quality construction, the shoes use a Vibram sole that has lasted very well over the last 3 months. There is a negative: they're squeeky, very squeeky
customer_reviews.author: Pimpernel Sandybanks

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Pair
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of Terraventure's a few years ago. I went hiking all the time and put them through the ringer. My 2nd pair was the MT-03, which was a good looking shoe, did well on the trail, but I missed the rockplate from the Terraventures. After I put those through hell, I found the Terraventure 2's and couldn't pass them up. I'm a 9.5 and these fit just perfect. Love the rockplate, comfort, and everything else about them. I don't do as much hiking, but they're still solid! Can't really find a negative about this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Pigeonman5000

customer_reviews.title: Total top quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best shoe out there, from the grippy tread/sole to the cushy yet supportive midsole to the complete comfort zone of the foot placement and movement within the toe box and footbed Truly will buy these from here forward
customer_reviews.author: adamW

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Size runs small.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable and nice to move in. I wear 9 men's and ordered a 9.5 as suggested by other reviewers (This was good advice and these fit like a glove). I recently wore these backpacking in the desert for four days and they are very breathable. I cannot comment on longevity as they are still new but they are an excellent to wear. Though I have not run in these shoes yet I believe they will do a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: Steele Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Topo shoes don't last
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Topo shoes and they just don't last. Sole is splitting away from shoe on this one. I doubt I will ever buy topo shoes again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Wish Topo wouldn’t have changed the design of their trail shoes. These are too narrow in toes now. Overall the shoe is tighter and the traction is terrible. Needs better lugs. Wet rocks and scree are not handled well by these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tlc01

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, I wear these as an everyday to work. I work in medical field and am on my feet much of the day. The wider toe box makes my feet feel more relaxed. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good fit and a good shoe. It does, however, have one small annoyance. The left shoe seems to press on my little toe. No big deal but not as smooth as I'd like. It's the second pair I've owned. The first pair, a previous model of the same shoe, fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dixon C. Barthel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit like my other Topos
customer_reviews.text: The toe portion was at least Ain inch in front of my big toe. Too large, and the heel portion was too shallow, so that I couldn't get my foot in all of the way down.
customer_reviews.author: Annie P.

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: 3rd pair of these for my hubby. He usually buys from REI but found them on Amazon. He says fit is just the same. He uses them for trail running.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty D.

customer_reviews.title: Shoes that finally fit my wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable and well made. They have a wide toe box and the top of the foot area is a bit wider so my big feet fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Quality materials, lightweight, comfortable and a perfect fit. I bought these shoes for trail running but liked them so much that I now find myself wearing them all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality control
customer_reviews.text: Left foot fit fine, right foot was not made correct.
customer_reviews.author: John Hess

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Roomy
customer_reviews.text: Toe splay! My feet feel so much better running in these nice roomy shoes than the ever-shrinking shoes on the market. However, I would prefer half sizes above 12.
customer_reviews.author: SoundEng

customer_reviews.title: Ugly feet deserve nice shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing topos for a year now. These are my third pair. I like these the best so far but have not been dissapointed by any of them. Definitely a minimal shoe. Not a lot of cushion but worth it for the room inside the shoe for your foot to spread out.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly made and started falling apart almost immediately. Do not buy! They also run small
customer_reviews.author: Tamra G.

customer_reviews.title: Even better than aftermarket toenails!
customer_reviews.text: First wide toe shoe I’ve run that didn’t facilitate toenails slamming into the toe box on downhills
customer_reviews.author: Tim Houger

customer_reviews.title: Best trail shoes I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had some Altras, Salomons, and other trail shoes, each of which were nice in some way, but these Topos are the best and most comfortable by far. The sole and midsole are not too soft, traction is great, the rock plate is superb, and open toe box is great to keeping toes splayed. Now need to figure out the Topo road shoe equivalent...
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Malcom

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: Rocks were not comfortable with these as they are with my hookas that do not have a rock plate. I found the shoes to be unstable on rocky surfaces and they didn't seem like they would be good shoes trails.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: An amazing trail show
customer_reviews.text: After ordering a number of different shoe brands to replace my Altra lonepeak 4s - including another paid on lonepeaks that seemed to be a different size, Saucony Peregine 10, and Altra Timp 2, I cautiously ordered the Terraventure 2s from Topo. I had low expectations. I'm between sizes (13-14 mens, and order a 13), so finding the right fit has been difficult - until now. I've been so happy with these one week in. So much so that I'm thinking about ordering additional pairs for when I wear these out. I'll likely add some velcro tape on the back for my gaiters.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Runs small.
customer_reviews.text: Bought half size up (11.5), and they were still too small. Quality was there, so im returning and ordering a full size up (12). Will update when received.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Better than altras
customer_reviews.text: Like altras but less sloppy in the heel and mid foot and more durable. Exactly what I was looking for with a narrow foot and wide toes.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Wren

customer_reviews.title: Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are a Christmas present so don,t have info yet.
customer_reviews.author: Joleta H. Worsham

product_meta.title: Topo Athletic Terraventure 2 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
product_meta.description:
* The Topo® Athletic Terraventure 2 trail running shoe is durable and rugged in a signature lightweight construction and a roomy toe box that promotes a comfortable and natural running experience.
   
 * Stack Height (Heel / Forefoot): 25mm / 22mm.
 * Heel-to-Toe Drop: 3mm.
 * Durable mesh and PU-printed upper features water-drainage ports for faster and quicker drying.
 * Padded collar and fully-gusseted tongue assists at keeping debris from entering the shoe and stay comfortably in place.
 * Traditional lace-up closure.
 * Two-density injected EVA midsole offers a more natural running experience.
 * Flexible ESS rock plate protects against rocks and roots.
 * Vibram® XS Trek outsole delivers unbeatable grip, traction, and durability.
 * Deep and spaced lugs provide improved underfoot traction in mud.
 * All Topo® shoes fit snug through the midfoot and heel to allow space for the toes to spread and splay, reducing that sloppy or disconnected feeling often associated with wider-fitting footwear.
 * Imported.
 * WARNING California's Proposition 65
 * Measurements:  *  Weight: 12 oz
   
   
 * Product measurements were taken using size 11, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size.
 * Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: A great choice for trail runners looking for a lighter, more responsive experience
Two layer abrasion resistant mesh upper
Gusseted tongue prevents dirt and debris from getting inside your shoe
Ghillie lacing system provides additional midfoot security in the upper
